text:
water treatment plants, is considered to have a lower environmental impact than other
alternative water supply methods, such as water transfers or desalination.’
The definition in Article 3 of ‘reclaimed water’ reads as follows: ‘(4) “reclaimed water” means
urban waste water that has been treated in compliance with the requirements set out in Directive
91/271/EEC and which results from further treatment in a reclamation facility in accordance with
Section 2 of Annex I to this Regulation …’.
